result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer to State of Illinois Probation Department.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. No  possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol. Random urine screens. No contact with Shari S.

Write a letter of apology to victim and submit to the District Attorney office.  Successfully complete and anger management class.  Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,329.20 made payable to Shari S.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA). All applicable fees of supervision.

No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
Payment plan as follows: $75/month beginning 10/10/14 and due the 10th of every month until all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution are paid in full.

timeConds.notes: From 10-3-14 at 5 p.m. to 10-5-14 at 5 p.m.. Straight time. Court stays commencement until 10-3-14 at 5:00 p.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary M Ochromowicz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation.  Court authorizes transfer to State of Illinois Probation Department.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 48 HOURS condition time from 10/03/14 at 5pm to 10/05/14 at 5:00pm. STRAIGH TIME.  Court stays commencement until 10/03/14 at 5:00pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Shari S.
- Write a letter of apology to victim and submit to the District Attorney office.
- Successfully complete and anger management class.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,329.20 made payable to Shari S; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Payment plan as follows: $75/month beginning 10/10/2014 and due the 10th of every month until all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution are paid in full.

Filed:  
Letter in Support of the Defendant
Defense Sentencing Documentation received and filed.
Restitution paperwork from Levy and Levy received and filed.

Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Irene Parthum.
-  AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED TO Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), Wisconsin Stat, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1, Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-10-2014 at 08:30 am.
Court Ordered Justice Point Monitoring ORDERED REMOVED as a condition of bail.

Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's Counsel requests modification of bail.  BAIL MODIFICATION REQUEST GRANTED BY THE COURT.  Justice Point Monitoring  as part of bail conditions is now ORDERED REMOVED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for 06-12-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense made motion to amend Justice Point supervision from enhanced to standard.  Court approved.

Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Randy Sitzberger for Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shari S. and Cassandra S.

Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Zachary M Ochromowicz in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation if released from custody due to employment income.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
